judges: Before Fell, C. J., Brown, Elkin, Stewart and Moschzisker, JJ.

opinions.text:
Opinion by
Mr. Justice Brown,
The dismissal of this appeal follows the reversal of the decree. Appeal dismissed at appellant’s costs.
opinions.author: Mr. Justice Brown,

attorneys: Stone & Stone and Wilson & Evans, for appellant.
casebody.head_matter:
Phillips, Appellant, v. Kleinman.
Argued May 1, 1911.
Appeal, No. 69, Oct. T., 1911, by plaintiffs, from decree of C. P. No. 4, Allegheny Co., Third Term, 1909, No. 851, in Equity, setting aside conveyance of real estate in case of Ferd H. Phillips, Trustee of the Estate of Edward Clarence Kleinman, Bankrupt, v. Emma Kleinman, Edward Clarence Kleinman and Thomas F. Garrahan.
Before Fell, C. J., Brown, Elkin, Stewart and Moschzisker, JJ.
Reversed.
Bill in equity to have a conveyance of real estate set aside as being in fraud of creditors. Before Swearingen, P. J.
See Phillips v. Kleinman, ante, p. 571.
Stone & Stone and Wilson & Evans, for appellant.
Frederic Walsingham Miller, for appellee.
July 6, 1911:
